blurb: Cairo is a general purpose language for writing ZK provable programs, without the need for a deep understanding of ZK concepts. Cairo is most often used for building trustless applications on Starknet.

key_features.title: Developer-friendly
key_features.content: Write Rust-like code and generate proofs for program execution - math isn't a barrier.

key_features.title: Provable
key_features.content: Produces provable programs, making it possible to compute trustworthy values on untrusted machines.

key_features.title: Efficient
key_features.content: Cairo compiles down to an ad-hoc assembly engineered specifically for efficient proof generation.

key_features.title: Immutable
key_features.content: Cairo uses the immutable memory model, improving data integrity and security.

key_features.title: General purpose
key_features.content: From onchain gaming to provable ML, Cairo makes building trustless applications possible.

key_features.title: Innovative
key_features.content: Cairo is a fast-growing language that keeps delivering new and exciting features to its developers.
